[vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_row_inner css=”.vc_custom_1659457408492{margin-bottom: 20px !important;background-color: #e2efff !important;}” el_class=”SPRow SPRowFull”][vc_column_inner width=”1/3″][vc_single_image image=”6861″ img_size=”full” alignment=”center”][vc_empty_space height=”20px”][/vc_column_inner][vc_column_inner width=”2/3″][vc_custom_heading text=”Maha Aleid, PhD
” font_container=”tag:h3|text_align:left|color:%231e73be” google_fonts=”font_family:Raleway%3A100%2C200%2C300%2Cregular%2C500%2C600%2C700%2C800%2C900|font_style:900%20bold%20regular%3A900%3Anormal” css=”.vc_custom_1659457401583{margin-top: 0px !important;margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”][vc_column_text]Director, Knowledge Translation – Saudi NIH[/vc_column_text][vc_custom_heading text=”Biography” font_container=”tag:h5|text_align:left|color:%231e73be” google_fonts=”font_family:Raleway%3A100%2C200%2C300%2Cregular%2C500%2C600%2C700%2C800%2C900|font_style:900%20bold%20regular%3A900%3Anormal” css=”.vc_custom_1658248932966{margin-top: 0px !important;margin-bottom: 0px !important;}”][vc_column_text]-Dr. Maha Aleid is the Director of Knowledge Translation at the Saudi National Institute for Health Research (Saudi NIH) with over 20 years of Research experience.

-Dr. Maha Aleid holds a PhD in Translational Medicine (2016) from Cranfield University, United Kingdom, and a Post. Diploma in Pharmaceuticals Regulatory Affairs from Toronto Institute of Pharmaceutical Technology, Canada (2009) and a bachelor’s in Pharmacy from King Saud University 2001.

-Dr. Maha Aleid has been head of Registries Core Facility at King Faisal Specialist Hospital & Research Centre, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, for over seven years.

-Lead Numerous (over 17) hospital-based, national, and international registries (since 2016).

-Lead funded research of Artificial Intelligence (AI) Group for Disability Research for the King Salman Center for Disability Research, Saudi Arabia (2019).

-Lead Several (over 50) hospital-based, national, and international epidemiological research projects (since 2011).

– Publish over 30 scientific populations in prestigious scientific journals for over 14 years[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row]
